_header: Now I have that I will
Note:
Part of a common proverb, for which see Whiting (1968)
XWhiting, Bartlett Jere. Proverbs, Sentences, and Proverbial Phrases from English Writings Mainly before 1500. Cambridge, MA: Belknap, 1968, G.317; cf. 6419.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Laud misc. 111 (SC 1550); Oxford, Lincoln College Lat. 52: not in this copy of Fasciculus morum; Durham, Durham University Library Cosin V.iv.2.
_description: A tag in the Fasciculus morum — one couplet

Bod187.Transcription: Now y haue þat y willegodys grame on þy bylle

Bod410.Transcription: Now I haue þat I wyllegoddis grame on þe bille

BodRawC670.Transcription: Now ich haue þat I wyleGoddus grame on þy byle
BodRawC670.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             “Some English Words from the Fasciculus Morum.” 
             Essays and Studies in Honor of Carleton Brown.
            Percy Waldron Long, ed. 
         New York: NYU Press; London: Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Pres,
            1940: 149-57: 151.
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 157.

CamGon71.Transcription: Now I haue þat I willcrist grame on þi bill

CamGon364.Transcription: Now I haue þat I wyllegoddis grame on þi bylle

CamStJohn159.Transcription: Now I haue þat I wyllgodis grame on þi byll

EDU82.Transcription: Nowe I haue that I wyllgodes grame in thy byll

Lincoln44.Transcription: Now y haue þat y willegodus grace on þis bille

Spalding.Transcription: Nowe I haue þat I wyllgoddes grame on þi byll

WorcF19.Transcription: Now y haue þat i wellgodis grame in þy bill
